intro: Palicourea squarrosa, commonly known as the roughleaf palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Palicourea squarrosa is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
